name: Mylee Ejercito
text: My parents were and still are definitely on the "keep your head down, don't get noticed, and we'll survive this" side. What I remember is that my dad was assigned somewhere else at the time (maybe Mindanao, maybe Cebu -- I can quite remember), and we lived basically across from Camp Crame, and we walked away from EDSA, towards Horseshoe/San Juan where the roads weren't blocked so relatives could pick us up and we would be somewhere safe.

source_obj.text: My parents were and still are definitely on the "keep your head down, don't get noticed, and we'll survive this" side.
